If he has a BMW, he trades it 7 for an Audi, if he has an Audi, he trades it for Mercedes. However, if he has a Mercedes, he is just as likely to trade it for a new Mercedes as to trade it for a BMW or Audi. In 2020 he bought his first car, which was a Mercedes. Find the probability that in 2022 he has (i) Mercedes (ii) BMW. UNIT â€“ IV

a) It has been found from experience that the mean breaking strength of a particular brand of 6 thread is 275.6 gms with standard deviation of 39.7 gms. Recently a sample of 36 pieces of thread shows a mean breaking strength of 253.2 gms. Can one conclude at level of significance of 5% and 1% that the thread has become inferior. b) One type of aircraft is found to develop engine trouble in 5 flights out of a total of 100 and 6 another type in 7 flights out of a total of 200 flights. Is there a significant difference in two types of aircrafts so as engine defects are concerned? c) Ten individuals are chosen at random from a population and their heights in inches are 6 found to be 63, 63, 66, 67, 68, 69, 70, 71, 71. Test the hypothesis that the mean height of the universe is 66 inches. (t =2.262 for 9 d.f. ). 0.05 Page 3 of 4 d) Four coins are tossed 100 times and the following results were obtained. 7 Construct a binomial distribution for the data and test the goodness of fit, given that =9.49 for 4 d.f. 2 0 1 2 3 4 ğœ’0.05 ğ‘ğ‘œ.ğ‘œğ‘“ â„ğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘‘ğ‘  5 29 36 25 5 ğ‘“ğ‘Ÿğ‘’ğ‘ğ‘¢ğ‘’ğ‘›ğ‘ğ‘¦ OR

a) A sample of 100 bulbs produced by company A showed a mean life of 1190 hrs and a 6 standard deviation of 90 hrs. Also, a sample of 75 bulbs produced by company B showed a mean life of 1230 hrs and a standard deviation of 120 hrs. Is there a difference between mean lifetime of bulbs produced by two companies at 5% and 1% level of significance. b) In 324 throws of a six faced die an odd number turned up 181 times.
